page.title: 09Plane Crash,Fearn.
page.content: In the summer of 1984 we saw a big black cloud of nsmoke and two parachutes in the air over Locheye.My mother and I went straight to the scene of the crash and we saw bits of an F1-11 just beside the loch.It blew up and the flames started a fire in the bushes.The fire brigade was soon at the scene and had it under control.While another F1-11 kept flying over the area, a helicopter flew in and took the crew away.They were unharmed.Next day American crash investigators were there and they took most of the bits of wreckage away for examination.The crop in the field where it crashed was ruined.Luckily little or no damage was done to homes.Planes still fly regularly over Fearn en route to the Tain Bombing Range. Many fly quite low over the school.
